description:
I fell in love instantly with this terminal. It feels very GTK; in a good way. It has many useful functions and the configuration rocks. 

My favorite feature is the split screen configuration and the smart shortcuts it has for navigating between them. Essential for sysadmins. 

The only thing I would add it's having it respect the "dark theme" configuration in GNOME.

Left Ctrl++ and Left Ctrl+- work very well in Ubuntu VirtualBox. I use this shortcuts all the time for increase/decrease font size in terminal.
So from now on I will use this terminal.
A big Thank You for the people who developed this program.

I wanted a terminal emulator capable of rendering fonts with ligatures (ex.: Fira Code) but didn't want to install Konsole with all its dependencies. Given that I'm still exploring QTerminal, it seems to work really well and is very customizable. It even comes with a drop-down terminal (Quake style) capability, like the one that Yakuake provides to Konsole. And is very lightweight indeed.
QTeminal like the Konsole looks ugly due to problem with text out with haotic transparent lines inder, which looks like garbage lines on the terminal window
summary: QT text out problem in Kubuntu

description: allows copy paste using drag and select on small touch screen amazing!!

Отличный терминал для среды KDE. Хорошая альтернатива Tillix. 
Единственный минус - это артефакты в виде горизонтальных полос, которые иногда проскакивают, но возможно это вызвано моим железом.
最喜欢它的多标签，而且界面简单好看
